questions.text: Causes of Asherman's syndrome leading to secondary amenorrhoea is
questions.solution: Schistosomiais and tuberculosis can cause secondary amenorrhoea due to intrauterine adhesion.

questions.text: 15 year old girl has come with C/O absent menstruation. On examination she has well developed breast but no pubic or axillary hair. What next?
questions.solution:
• Axillary hair & pubic hairs → Androgens
  • Both are absent in Androgen Insenstivity

Investigation to differentiate MRKH from AIS is Karyotyping

choices.text: Measuring AMH twice 4 to 6 weeks apart
Measuring FSH twice 4 to 6 weeks apart

questions.text: 38 year old woman H/O 6 months amenorrhoea. she has three children, all delivered by caesarean section. Her urine gravindex is negative. Her mother had premature menopause at the age of 35 years. Now her diagnosis is based on
questions.solution: FSH has to be ideally measured twice 4 to 6 weeks apart o diagnose menopause

questions.text: Following are the causes of amenorrhoea with secondary sexual characteristics, normal breast and normal pelvic anatomy, all except
questions.solution: Hypothalamic dysfunction is associated with less FSH and LH, hence ovaries do not produce hormones. Secondary sexual characters would be absent.

questions.text: The causes of primary amenorrhoea with secondary sexual characteristics, normal breast development but abnormal genital tract formation are all except
questions.solution: In Turner’s syndrome secondary sexual characteristics are absent.

questions.text: Following are the causes for secondary amenorrhoea without hyperandrogenism except
questions.solution: Theca cells are the site for androgen synthesis in the ovary. Ovarian hyperthecosis is associated with hyperandrogenism occurring in postmenopausal mostly and occasionally in premenopausal women.

questions.text:
Symptoms of hyperprolactinemia are
1. Galactorrhoea
2. Visual changes
3. Headache
4. Amenorrhoea
5. Hirsutism
questions.solution: Hyperprolactinemia leads to loss of ovarian function. Hirsuitism is a feature of hyperandrogenism and not hyperprolactinemia

questions.text: Management of Androgen Insensitivity syndrome include all except
questions.solution: Management of AIS include gonadecttomy after puberty, vaginoplasty and counseling. Gonadotropins have no role after a gonadectomy has been performed.

questions.text:
Regarding Clinical features of PCOS
1. Acanthosis nigricans
2. Sleep apnoea
3. Infertility
4. Obesity
5. Virilisation
questions.solution:
Long term problems

  • Endometrial cancer
  • Diabetes,obesity,infertility
  • Recurrent early pregnancy loss

(poor IVF success rates)

  • Clomiphere citrate > 12 cycles

(may increase ovarian cancer risk)

  • Ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome
  • Adhesions
  • Metrorragia

choices.text: LH/FSH > 2:1, high free testosterone, low SHBG
LH/FSH < 2:1, high free testosterone, high SHBG
FSH/LH >2:1, low free testosterone, low SHBG

questions.text: Biochemical parameters which reflect a diagnosis of PCOD are
questions.solution:
Investigations in PCOS

  • Ultrasound - transvaginal ultrasound is best
  • LH/FSH- 3:1 (N=1.5:1)
  • Increased Free testosterone
  • Low SHBG

questions.text: Following are the investigations needed during evaluation of Turner's syndrome except
questions.solution: MRI brain is used in hyperprolactinemia to look for pituitary adenoma in amenorrhea.

questions.text: 39 year old woman C/O secondary amenorrhorea with secondary infertility. she gives H/O severe pre ecclampsia in her first pregnancy. She has occasional breast discharge. h/o loss of libido present. She has been started on methyldopa as an anti-hypertensive. What is the cause of her secondary infertility.
questions.solution:
Pharmacological causes of HyperProlactinemia

  • Estrogen therapy
  • Anesthesia
  • DA receptor blocking agents
    • Phenothiazones
    • Haloperidol
  • Inhibition of DA turnover
    • Opiates
  • DA re-uptake blocker
    • Nomifensine
  • CNS-DA depleting agents
    • Reserpine
    • a-methyldopa
    • MAO inhibitor
  • Stimulation of serotoninergic system
    • Amphetamines
    • Hallucinogens

Histamine H2-receptor antagonists

questions.text: 15 year old girl with primary amenorrhoea with cyclical lower abdominal pain and discomfort. O/E a mass per abdomen palpable. On vulval examination, a pink bulging membrane visualized at the introitus
questions.solution: Transverse vaginal septum is pink whereas an imperforate hymen presents as a blue bulging membrane.

questions.text: A 25 year old primigravida presents with 8 weeks amenorrhea and a positive pregnancy test. An ultrasound suggests a 6 weeks non viable pregnancy. Which of the following is the most common cause of such presentation?
questions.solution:
Common Causes of abortion First trimester:

  1. Genetic factors (50%) : commonest cause
  2. Endocrine disorders (luteal phase defect, thyroid abnormalities, and diabetes)
  3. Immunological disorders (autoimmune and alloimmune)
  4. Infection
  5. Unexplained

choices.text: Continue next pill next day onwards
Take 3 pills next day, then shift on one pill per day
Take the pill as soon as possible and continue remaining pills at usual time plus use back up contraception (condom or abstinence) for next 7 days
Take 2 pills each for rest of the cycle

questions.text: A woman on combined OCPs forgot to take them for 2 successive doses. Next line of management is:
questions.solution:
RECOMMENDATION OF MISSED OCPs

1 pill missed

  • Take missed as soon as possible
  • Then continue with one pill per day

2 or more pills missed:

  • Take most recent pill as soon as possible
  • Continue taking remaining pills at usual time
  • Use back up contraception (e.g, condoms) or avoid sexual intercourse until hormonal pills have been taken for 7 consecutive days

choices.text: Primary oocyte is arrested at prophase - I at birth
LH surge occurs 24-48 hrs. prior to ovulation
First polar body is released at ovulation

questions.text: Onset of menstruation along with cyclical changes that occur in ovaries and endometrium after puberty, are responsible for making a woman capable of reproduction. All are true regarding events related to oogenesis EXCEPT
questions.solution:
• Meiosis-II is 'not' a reduction division, as it doesn't reduce the chromosome number into half.
  • Chromosome number gets reduced to half during meiosis- I (reduction division).
  • Primary oocyte gets arrested at prophase- I before birth (while the baby is still in-utero).
  • LH surge occurs 24-48 hrs. prior to ovulation.

questions.text: A 25 year old woman presents with dysmenorrhea with regular cycles. On examination the doctor explains that the pain is due to acute retroverted uterus which is an abnormal position of the uterus. Which of the following is responsible for maintaining the normal position?
questions.solution:
The normal position of the uterus is anteversion.

Anteversion of uterus is maintained by Round ligament.

Round Ligaments are extension of the uterine musculature and represent the homolog of the gubernaculum testis.

Anteversion: angle between uterus and vagina- 90°

Anteflexion: angle between uterus and cervix (at internal os)- 120°

questions.text: A 28 year old woman P1L1 presents to the clinic with complains of foul smelling vaginal discharge along with pain in lower abdomen. She has regular menstrual cycles, with dysmenorrhea and does not use any contraception. The clinician examines her and advices her for antibiotics. She however is non compliant with medications. Which of the following condition is she likely to develop?
questions.solution:
The history of vaginal discharge, pain abdomen and dysmenorrhea point towards pelvic inflammatory disease. Untreated long standing cases may lead to formation of pus in uterus.

Other long term complications of PID

  • Infertility
  • Chronic pelvic pain
  • Dyspareunia
  • Increased risk of ectopic pregnancy
  • Pelvic adhesions, hydrosalpinx, pyosalpinx
  • Intestinal obstruction

Pus in the uterus, Pyometra, is a complication of the following conditions

  • Cancer cervix
  • Senile Endometritis
  • Ca endometrium
  • Tuberculosis
  • Post Radiotherapy

The pyometra also should be drained, and the patient should be given antibiotics.

questions.text: A 38 year old woman with irregular cycles, presents with milk discharge from bilateral breasts. The clinician orders for serum prolactin levels. Minimum level of prolactin that definitely suggest hyperprolactinemia is?
questions.solution:
Elevations in prolactin may cause amenorrhea or galactorrhea.

Amenorrhea without galactorrhea is associated with hyperprolactinemia in approximately 15% of women.

In patients with both galactorrhea and amenorrhea, approximately two-thirds will have hyperprolactinemia; of those, approximately one-third will have a pituitary adenoma.

In more than one-third of women with hyperprolactinemia, a radiologic abnormality consistent with a microadenoma (<1 cm) is found.

Normal Prolactin levels

  • Males: 2-20 ng/mL
  • Females (non-pregnant): 2-30 ng/mL
  • Pregnant females: 10-200 ng/mL

A prolactin level of more than 200 ng/mL is usually due to a pituitary tumour and requires pituitary evaluation

questions.text: A 40 year old woman underwent hysterectomy for abnormal menstrual bleeding with a pelvic mass. The image of the gross specimen removed during surgery is given below. What will be the diagnosis?
questions.solution:
The image shows a gross hysterectomy specimen showing multiple fibroids/ leiomyomas. This can present as abnormal uterine bleeding (usually menorrhagia) and pelvic mass.

Recognition is based on a solid, well defined lesion, inside a pseudocapsule, without any surrounding invasion, with a whorling pattern, which differentiates it from a malignancy and adenomyosis.

questions.text: A 38 year old woman presents with secondary amenorrhea. Her previous menstrual cycles were regular with normal flow. Which of the following is a cause of secondary amenorrhea:
questions.solution:
Normal ovaries are extremely sensitive to radiotherapy hence pelvic irradiation, given for various pelvic malignancies may cause secondary amenorrhea by causing ovarian failure.

Otherwise, the more common causes of secondary amenorrhea in women are pregnancy, polycystic ovarian syndrome, hyperprolactinemia, tuberculosis, uterine synechiae, premature ovarian failure and hypothalamic dysfunction.

Pregnancy must be considered in all women of reproductive age with amenorrhea.

Diabetes is not directly a cause of amenorrhea. Kallman syndrome and imperforate hymen cause primary amenorrhea.

questions.text: A woman at 33 years of age with heavy menstrual cycles and infertility is under evaluation. Her hormonal profile is normal and she is not responding to medical management, thus she is planned for hysteroscopy. Upon Hysteroscopy which of the following cannot be evaluated:
questions.solution:
Hysteroscopy is best for diagnosing lesions within the uterine cavity

Also:

  • Abnormal Uterine Bleeding
  • Oligomenorrhea amenorrhea,
  • Recurrent Pregnancy loss
  • Endometrial carcinoma,
  • Un-explained infertility
  • Suspected anomalies
  • Missing IUCDs
  • Diagnosing intra uterine submucous fibroids, Polyps, adhesions Septums etc.

questions.text: A woman presents with heavy bleeding during periods with mild pain in her lower abdomen. On ultrasound a 4 x 5 cm sized submucosal fibroid is seen All of the following may be the reasons for pain in this patient, EXCEPT?
questions.solution:
Pain due to torsion is seen with pedunculated subserosal fibroid

Torsion is not characteristic of a Sub Mucosalfibroid

Pain in sub mucosal fibroid is due to:

  • Fibroid degeneration
  • Large size
  • Sarcomatous change

questions.text: A 25 - year - old lady presented with curdy white discharge from vagina with itching over vulva, is likely to be suffering from:
questions.solution:
Candidiasis

  • Dimorphic fungi
    • Blastospores(spread)
    • Mycelia( invasive and adherent)
  • Occur in acidic pH
  • Curdy white discharge
  • Plaques on vaginal wall →On removal→ Petechiae
  • Out of proportion Pruritis
  • Rx:
    • Azoles
    • Oral Fluconazole
    • Rx both female and male

questions.text: A 27 year old woman, married for 3 years is unable to conceive. She is otherwise healthy but has delayed menstrual cycles. An ultrasound done for follicle monitoring shows absence of a developing follicle with evidence of polycystic ovaries. Which of the following drug should be used first line in her next cycle for her condition?
questions.solution:
Letrozole is the Drug of choice- Induction of ovulation in a case of PCOS;

  • Mode of action-
    • Aromatase Inhibitor
    • Decrease Estrogen production-->Inhibit Negative feedback on FSH --> increases FSH --> increase stimulation of follicles
  • Letrozole preferred over Clomiphene citrate because
    • decreases chances of multifetal pregnancy
    • increased live birth rate
    • OHSS : Rare with it
  • Given for 5 days (D5-D9)
    • Start with 2.5mg
    • Max dose 7.5mg

choices.text: Post partum woman lactating her newborn

questions.text: Four women are seen at a primary health care centre for contraceptive advice. Which of the following is the MOST favourable candidate for combined OCP's?
questions.solution:
Absolute contraindications

  • < 6 wks postpartum
  • smoker over the age of 35 (>15 cigarettes per day)
  • hypertension (systolic > 160mmHg or diastolic > 100mmHg)
  • current or past history of venous thromboembolism (VTE)
  • ischemic heart disease
  • history of cerebrovascular accident
  • complicated valvular heart disease (pulmonary hypertension, atrial fibrillation, history of subacute bacterial endocarditis)
  • migraine headache with focal neurological symptoms
  • breast cancer (current)
  • diabetes with retinopathy/nephropathy/neuropathy
  • liver tumour (adenoma or hepatoma)

Relative contraindications

  • smoker over the age of 35 (< 15 cigarettes per day)
  • adequately controlled hypertension
  • hypertension (systolic 140 - 159mmHg or diastolic 90 - 99mmHg)
  • migraine headache over the age of 35
  • currently symptomatic gallbladder disease
  • history of combined OCP-related cholestasis

questions.text: A 38 year old woman presents with creamy white watery discharge with fishy odour from vagina along with minimal itching. Which of the following is the most likely cause?
questions.solution:
Bacteria Vaginosis

  • MC Vaginitis
  • Hemophilus vaginalis aka Gardenella vaginalis
  • Fishy vaginal odor,
  • Vaginal secretions are gray and thinly coat the vaginal walls
  • Microscopy:- Clue cells-Vaginal epithelium with embeded bacteria
  • No pruritus,
  • The Whiff test- The addition of KOH to the vaginal secretions releases a amine like odor.
  • Amsel's criteria is used for diagnosis
  • Treatment:
    • Metronidazole,
    • Treat the woman(No sexual transmission)

questions.text: A woman using combined oral contraceptive pill for 8 years is concerned about long term side effects of the pill. Which of the following benign tumor can be caused by prolonged use of oral contraceptive pills?
questions.solution:
Adenomas have been reported with prolonged use of OC pills and though they are benign, rupture of a hepatoma can be fatal. Because the hormones are metabolized in the liver, chronic liver diseases and recent jaundice contraindi­cate the use of pills.

Also, Gall bladder function may be adversely affected. Gall stones are reported with OCP use, but not Gall bladder carcinoma

questions.text: Karyotype of a primary oocyte is
questions.solution:
Also know no of oocytes- 20th week-7 million ( Maximum )

At birth-2 million

At puberty-4 lakh

Migration of germ cells from yolk Sac- 3rd week

Reach gonadal rigde at 4th week

No.of oocytes realeased throughout reproductive period- 400

No. of oocytes at menopause -1000

No. Of oocyte depleted/month-1000

First meiotic division gets arrested at prophase

Second meiotic division gets arrested at metaphase

No of chromosomes

Primary Oocytes - 46 XX

Secondary Oocytes- 23X

1st polar body-23X

2nd polar body-23X

Mature Ovum (after fertilization) - 46XX or 46XY

1st polar body comes from-primary oocyte

1st polar body comes as a result of -1st meiotic division

1st polar body comes along with-Secondary oocyte

2nd polar body comes from-secondary oocyte

2nd polar body comes as a result of-2nd meiotic division

2nd polar body comes along with-mature ovum

2nd polar body comes only after fertilization

Mature ovum- Largest cell of the body - 130μ

questions.text: The most common mullerian anomaly is
questions.solution: Most common uterine anomaly is septate and the second most common is bicornuate uterus

questions.text: Speed of the sperm in the female genital tract is
According to figo classification of fibroids, a Submucus fibroid which is less than 50% inside the myometrium belongs to fibroid no
questions.solution:
SM-Submucosal:

0 - Pedunculated intracavitary

1 - <50% Intramural

2 - ≥ 50% intramural

O-Other:

3- Contact endometrium, 100% intramural

4- Intramural

5- Suberosal ≥ 50% intramural

6- Suberosal <50% intramural

7- Subserosal pedunculated

8- Other (epecify e.g. cervical, parasitic)

Hybrid Leiomyomas:

Two numbers are listed separated by a hyphen, By convention the first refers to the relationship with the endometrium while the second refers to the relationship to the serosa.

questions.text: Polycythemia is a complication of
questions.solution:
Most commons in Fibroid:

  • Fibroids are most commonly Uterine
  • MC uterine fibroid is interstitial
  • All fibroids to begin with start as an interstitial fibroid
  • MC extra uterine fibroid is cervical fibroid
  • A pedunculated subserous fibroid sometimes detached itself from the uterus and gets attached to a vascular organ and exists independently - Parasitic fibroid
  • Most symptomatic fibroid is submucous fibroid
  • MC fibroid causing retention of urine - Anterior and Central cervical fibroids
  • MC fibroid to undergo necrosis - submucous fibroid
  • MC fibroid to undergo calcareous degeneration - subserous
  • MC fibroid to undergo malignant change - submucous
  • Lantern on St.Paul’s church refers to a cervical fibroid

MC fibroid to undergo torsion - Pedunculated subserous fibroid

questions.text: A 26 year old women married for 3year with irregular and unpredictable periods has been evaluated for infertility. USg revealed multiple peripheral cyst in both ovaries, true about the long term sequel of this condition are
questions.solution:
Long term sequel

  • Diabetes
  • Endometrial hyperplasia
  • Endometrial cancer
  • Cardiovascular problems
  • Metabolic syndrome
  • infertility
  • Depresssion and mood disorders

questions.text: Version is the angle between
questions.solution:
Flexion - Angle between uterus and cervix, Normal angle of flexion is 120 degree

Version - Angle between cervix and vagina, Normal angle of version is 90 degree

questions.text: A 35 yr old female was prescribed oral contraceptive pill with a combination of ethinyl estradiol and norgesterol. On follow up, she was found to have moderate increase in blood pressure. The physician changed her treatment to a combination of Ethinyl estradiol and Drosperinone. Which of the following adverse effects can be expected in this patient?
questions.solution:
Drosperinone is a Spironolactone analogue with anti-mineralocorticoid and anti-androgenic activity.

It suppresses LH and ovulation by binding to progesterone receptor and alters cervical mucus.

It is the only progestin drug with definite anti-hypertensive effect by increasing sodium excretion.

It might induce Hyperkalemia.

questions.text: Antidepressants have been shown to be effective for the treatment of hot flushes related to hormonal therapies for breast cancer. However, some may inhibit the enzyme CYP2D6, which converts tamoxifen to its active form and thus may interfere with tamoxifen activity. Which of the following antidepressants inhibits CYP2D6 to the greatest degree?
questions.solution:
Tamoxifene therapy is approved for treatment for Estrogen receptor positive Ca. Breast.

Being a pro drug, it must be converted to the active form by CYP2D6.

And, Tamoxifene might induce hot flushes for which anti-depressants like Paroxetine and Venlafaxine can be administered.

But, Paroxetine additionally inhibits CYP2D6 which might prevent the activation of Tamoxifene causing treatment failure.

questions.text: A 10 yr old boy came with sudden swelling in his arms, legs, abdomen to the emergency and on examination he was found to be having very low levels of C1 esterase inhibitor in his blood. Which of the following androgenic drug could prevent further episodes like this in this patient?
questions.solution:
The signs and symptoms suggest that the patient is suffering from Hereditary angioedema caused due to deficiency of C1 esterase inhibitor.

Chronic androgenic treatment effectively might prevent the episodes of angioedema like Danazol. Because, Nandrolone has got no additional C1 esterase inhibitor activity.

choices.text: Serum testosterone - Levels might be increased

questions.text: A 68 yr old male was diagnosed with advanced prostatic cancer and was put under palliative therapy with Leuprolide. The patient reported for follow up. Due to certain complications which might develop due to Leuprolide the physician prescribed some investigations. Which of the following investigations is not paired with its correct indication?
questions.solution:
Warnings and Precautions for use of Leuprolide:

  1. Tumor flare - Closely observed during first weeks of therapy
  2. Hyperglycemia and Diabetes - HbA1c must be monitored
  3. ECG - Risk of developing MI and QT prolongation
  4. Serum testosterone - Risk of increased testosterone levels above baseline and declined thereafter after 4 weeks.

questions.text: A 27 yr old female who is taking OCP for contraception, informs the physician that her husband has been diagnosed as tuberculosis and is under treatment for 2 months. She, being a household contact, was screened for TB and found to be AFB positive and was also put under anti-TB regimen. What can be expected in this patient if the treatment continues?
questions.solution: Rifampicin, being a microsomal enzyme inducer and a first line anti-TB drug, can cause breakthrough bleeding and pregnancy in young women who were treated with oral contraceptive pills due to enhanced metabolism of steroidal drugs that might cause contraceptive failure.

choices.text: at the time of LH surge

questions.text: The first polar body is extruded:
questions.solution:
The 46 XX primary oocyte undergoes meiosis which consists of two phases. Phase 1: Meiosis (reduction division) results in the formation of secondary oocyte (with a large amount of cytoplasm) and the first polar body (with little cytoplasm). The first polar body is extruded at the end of the first phase of meiotic division. This is immediately followed by ovulation. Ovulation is the release of the secondary oocyte from the ovary.

Phase 2: The 23X secondary oocyte immediately begins a mitotic division but this is arrested in metaphase until fertilization occurs. After fertilization, the mitotic division is completed and the second polar body is extruded.

questions.text: Which of the following hormone peaks during the mid-luteal phase?
questions.solution: Inhibin from the ovary inhibits the release of FSH from the pituitary.

questions.text: The satiety-producing hormone is:
questions.solution: Leptin (polypeptide; coded by ob gene) is a hormone secreted by adipocytes. It has an action on the hypothalamus to inhibit food intake (anorexigenic hormone). It presumably signals the amount of fat to the CNS. Leptin levels increase after a meal. Leptin receptors are coded by db gene. Leptin deficiency as well as deficiency of functional leptin receptors have been implicated in the pathogenesis of obesity. Significant weight loss (fat loss) is accompanied by a reduction in serum leptin. Also, when serum levels of leptin are abnormally low, GnRH secretion is eventually downregulated. Low serum leptin may in part explain amenorrhea that occurs in athletes and individuals with thyrotoxicosis.

questions.text: The Following USG image in 28 yr old female presenting with amenorrhea is due to?
questions.solution: The Usg image shows the Double Bleb Sign formed due to Amnion and Yolk sac giving an appearance of two small bubbles and suggests a true intrauterine gestational Sac

questions.text: A female on antenatal scan is told that there is a problem with her fetus, the following usg image is obtained, probable diagnosis is?
questions.solution:
• The Antenatal Scan Image shows Absent cranial bones and absent supraorbital brain parenchyma giving the appearance of Frog eye appearance on Antenatal scan suggestive of Anencephaly

Anencephaly is the earliest congenital malformation to be diagnosed as early as 10-12 weeks of gestation.

questions.text: Scrotal Usg image of a 25 year old male given, Most likely diagnosis is?
questions.solution: The Usg image given shows bilateral multiple small echogenic nonshadowing foci of uniform size throughout the testicles suggestive of testicular microlithiasis

questions.text: Diagnose based on the given ultrasound image below from a patient with infertility
Identify the Given Image below?
Identify the given HSG image
All of the following types of human papilloma virus (HPV) are considered high-risk types EXCEPT:
questions.solution: The high risk HPV types are listed as primarily 16and 18, but also types 31, 33, 35, 39, 45, 51, 52, 56, 58, 59, 68, 73, and 82. HPV types 26, 53, and 66 have been defined as probably high risk. HPV types 6, 11, 4, 42, 43, 44, 54, 61, 70, 72, and 81 are included in the low risk group.
